availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Rauth (Cincinnati, clerk, lieut. 1st Ky Ind. Battery )

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, clerk and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Francis Rauth and Mary Rauth. Clerk in Cincinnati in 1860. Clerk in 1862. Served in the 1st Kentucky Independent Battery (U.S.A.) as private, corporal, and lieutenant from March 16, 1862, to March 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 10, p. 26.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0152.
